AD_CircusComment.synopsis: The spirit of the amulet comments on entering the circus area in Wyrm's Crossing.
AD_CircusComment.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Get" or "oe SAM_Start"- Walk to the circus area and into the trigger S_WYR_SentientAmulet_Banter_Circus_Trigger_6f605103-66d3-4eaa-ad44-37b87b3f2b44

AD_MonkLeavesZombie.synopsis: During the zombie combat in the Sentient Amulet situation, the monk will be possessing one of the zombies. If the possessed zombie goes below half health, the monk will hop to another zombie and heal it. This AD will be played on the zombie that is about to be unpossessed.
AD_MonkLeavesZombie.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Combat"- Locate the zombie with the "Possessed" status (initially it will be Sister Shirra). Get them down below half health without killing them.- On the possessed zombie's turn, the monk's ghost will leave this zombie's body and play this AD.

AD_Tomb_Plaque_02.synopsis: Investigating the plaque on a coffin in the Open Hand Temple crypt. One of the monks is buried here.
AD_Tomb_Plaque_02.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Crypt"- Interact with S_WYR_SentientAmulet_Tomb_Plaque_002_80c5321b-de4f-4c8c-853b-e10b2d40de14

AD_MonkNoMoreZombies.synopsis: During the zombie combat in the Sentient Amulet situation, the monk will be possessing one of the zombies. If the possessed zombie goes below half health, the monk will hop to another zombie and heal it. This AD will play on the possessed zombie if there are no other zombies available to possess.
AD_MonkNoMoreZombies.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Combat"- Locate the zombie with the "Possessed" status (initially it will be Sister Shirra). Get them down below half health without killing them.- Before you end your turn, kill all the non-possessed zombies.- On the possessed zombie's turn, the monk's ghost will be unable to leave this zombie's body and play this AD.

AD_OpenHandTempleComment.synopsis: The spirit of the amulet comments on entering the Open Hand Temple, where we should look for his granddaughter, Shirra Clarwen.
AD_OpenHandTempleComment.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Start"- Walk into the Open Hand Temple ahead.

AD_Tomb_Plaque_03.synopsis: Investigating the plaque on a coffin in the Open Hand Temple crypt. One of the monks is buried here.
AD_Tomb_Plaque_03.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Crypt"- Interact with S_WYR_SentientAmulet_Tomb_Plaque_003_2d7269f8-084a-463e-93dd-f0d5b28c812f

AD_Possession.synopsis: A player opens up Shirra Clarwen's crypt with the Sentient Amulet in tow. This will make the Mad Monk inside the amulet possess Shirra's body.
AD_Possession.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Crypt"- Interact with S_WYR_SentientAmulet_Tomb_Lid_97f1280f-f052-4988-b59d-5f972c9651d6

PAD_EnteredCrypt.synopsis: A companion reacts to entering the Open Hand Temple crypt after learning that Shirra Clarwen, granddaughter of the Mad Monk inside the Sentient Amulet, has passed away and is interred here.
PAD_EnteredCrypt.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use "oe SAM_Crypt" and "SetGlobalOsirisFlag WYR_SentientAmulet_Knows_ShirraIsInCrypt"ORUse "oe SAM_Start", talk to Sister Yannis in the Open Hand Temple after her discussion with Valeria, ask about Shirra Clarwen and then head down to the crypt.- Make sure you haven't read the plaque on Shirra's coffin or opened the tomb yet.

AfterCombat.synopsis: After fighting the Mad Monk and his possessed zombies in Shirra Clarwen's crypt below the Open Hand Temple, the Mad Monk says his goodbyes and disappears.
AfterCombat.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Crypt"- Interact with S_WYR_SentientAmulet_Tomb_Lid_97f1280f-f052-4988-b59d-5f972c9651d6- Attack the ghost or zombie, and killcombat after all the zombies have come to life.- This should play after the possessed zombie drops dead.

Zombie.synopsis: A player opens up Shirra Clarwen's crypt with the Sentient Amulet in tow. This will make the Mad Monk inside the amulet possess Shirra's body.
Zombie.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Crypt"- Interact with S_WYR_SentientAmulet_Tomb_Lid_97f1280f-f052-4988-b59d-5f972c9651d6

AD_MonkCombatStart.synopsis: If you refuse the Mad Monk's possession or attack the Monk or the zombies he is puppeteering, combat will start. The zombie that the Mad Monk is possessing will say this line when combat starts.
AD_MonkCombatStart.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Combat"- This AD will play on the possessed zombie.

AD_Tomb_Plaque_01.synopsis: Investigating the plaque on a coffin in the Open Hand Temple crypt. One of the monks is buried here.
AD_Tomb_Plaque_01.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Crypt"- Interact with S_WYR_SentientAmulet_Tomb_Plaque_001_1e5e7950-6908-492a-93c4-856c04c83368

AD_MonkEntersZombie.synopsis: During the zombie combat in the Sentient Amulet situation, the monk will be possessing one of the zombies. If the possessed zombie goes below half health, the monk will hop to another zombie and heal it. This AD will be played on the zombie that the monk will now start possessing.
AD_MonkEntersZombie.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Combat"- Locate the zombie with the "Possessed" status (initially it will be Sister Shirra). Get them down below half health without killing them.- On the possessed zombie's turn, the monk's ghost will leave that zombie, and enter the new zombie's body. This AD will then play on the newly possessed zombie.

PAD_TombNoAmulet.synopsis: Try to interact with Shirra Clarwen's tomb lid without having access to the Sentient Amulet that contains the Mad Monk. The Mad Monk wants to be reunited with Shirra, his granddaughter.
PAD_TombNoAmulet.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Crypt"- Unequip the Sentient Amulet- Read the plaque of the back left tomb- Interact with S_WYR_SentientAmulet_Tomb_Lid_97f1280f-f052-4988-b59d-5f972c9651d6

PAD_Tomb_Plaque.synopsis: Investigating the plaque on the coffin in the Open Hand Temple crypt. Shirra Clarwen is buried here - the granddaughter of the Sentient Amulet's Mad Monk.
PAD_Tomb_Plaque.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Crypt"- Interact with S_WYR_SentientAmulet_Tomb_Plaque_641ec497-4208-4f57-a01b-40c9997edfae

PAD_PostResolutionComment.synopsis: The party comments on the resolution of the Sentient Amulet situation - the Mad Monk disappears into thin air and "moves on". We either suffered through his laughing madness (we were temporarily possessed) or fought him.
PAD_PostResolutionComment.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Use ReCon command "oe SAM_Crypt"- Interact with S_WYR_SentientAmulet_Tomb_Lid_97f1280f-f052-4988-b59d-5f972c9651d6- Go through the dialogue - either suffering through the Mad Monk's madness or engaging in combat. After the Mad Monk disappears once and for all, a companion will react with this PAD.

AD_CircusComment_0.text: Ho ho, a circus! How I love the raucous revelry, the goofs and the guffaws.

AD_MonkLeavesZombie_0.text: Hee! This flesh cannot contain me!

AD_Tomb_Plaque_02_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Tomb_Plaque_02_0.text:
*Here lies Suttida Attana.
Born 1411 DR - Died 1485 DR*

AD_OpenHandTempleComment_0.text: Here we be, ha-ha! Take me to my cherished Shirra, and thy rewards shall be plenty.

AD_Tomb_Plaque_03_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Tomb_Plaque_03_0.text:
*Here lies Flinster Sunseeker.
Born 1400 DR - Died 1456 DR*

AD_Possession_0.text: Ha-he-ho-HOO! Darling Shirra, faithful to the Crying God. Long didst I wait, only to find thine empty flesh.

PAD_EnteredCrypt_0.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteredCrypt_0.text: A crypt. This must be where Shirra Clarwen is buried.

AfterCombat_2.speaker: Monk's Manifestation
AfterCombat_2.text: HaHEE! Eternally cursed then, my spirit be!

AfterCombat_0.speaker: Monk's Manifestation
AfterCombat_0.text: I - no. Morninglord, I call to thee, lend your forbearance! No - no - haha - haHA -
AfterCombat_0.context: NodeContext: The monk, still mad, is dying, and his god will not answer him...

AfterCombat_1.speaker: Monk's Manifestation
AfterCombat_1.text: HAHA-HEEHEE-ha ha ha... ha ha... ha...
AfterCombat_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Monk's spirit fades as he 'dies'.NodeContext: Laughter trails off as the monk's spirit fades...

Zombie_20.speaker: Shirra Clarwen
Zombie_20.text: Oh ho, honoured Shirra. Her spirit hath fled - and her body but merely a husk. Heh heh hee-hee-HEE!

Zombie_24.speaker: Shirra Clarwen
Zombie_24.text: Swear, I did, to shed this foul mania and bestow it upon Shirra! She was to endure, to suffer, as was her god Ilmater's wont!

Zombie_3.speaker: Shirra Clarwen
Zombie_3.text: Who, now, shall bear the madness Shar has wrought on me, so I might no longer suffer?

Zombie_51.speaker: Player
Zombie_51.text: If it will bring you peace, I will bear the madness.

Zombie_45.speaker: Narrator
Zombie_45.text: *Your muscles tingle and your mouth twitches as the laughing madness spreads through you.*
Zombie_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Mad Monk's ghost leaps from the zombie into the player.

Zombie_1.speaker: Narrator
Zombie_1.text: *The madness tugs at your mind, prods in places best left untouched. You feel your wisdom begin to drain...*

Zombie_12.speaker: Player
Zombie_12.text: Call on your wits and shield your mind's most vulnerable reaches.

Zombie_5.speaker: Narrator
Zombie_5.text: *You remain wise as ever, even as Shar's madness spreads outward.*

Zombie_17.speaker: Narrator
Zombie_17.text: *You giggle, struck by the absurdity of the moment. A spirit hiding inside an amulet has brought you to the body of his granddaughter and possessed it. Outrageous! Ridiculous!*

Zombie_53.speaker: Narrator
Zombie_53.text: *Once again, you feel your wisdom draining away. Hilarious! Or is it?*

Zombie_30.speaker: Player
Zombie_30.text: Muster your senses, clear your mind. You will take the madness, but it will not take of you.

Zombie_8.speaker: Narrator
Zombie_8.text: *The urge to laugh dwindles, though you can't help but chuckle. You withstood the monk's madness and earned Tasha's Hideous Laughter.*

Zombie_31.text: My friend - forgive me, for this mind was not mine own. May laughter be thy gift, never thy curse.
Zombie_31.context: NodeContext: Serious for the first time. The monk has been cleansed of madness and can go to the god Lathander.

Zombie_49.text: The Morninglord calls. Canst thou feel the warmth of his blessing? This is not my final twilight... but a new dawn.
Zombie_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Mad Monk's spirit laughs and vanishes into the sky.NodeContext: Dead serious. The monk has been cleansed of madness and can go to the god Lathander.

Zombie_48.context: NodeContext: A wistful and trailing goodbye. The monk has been cleansed of madness and can go to the god Lathander.

Zombie_25.speaker: Narrator
Zombie_25.text: *The corpse is an empty husk once more. The monk, liberated from madness, is finally at peace.*
Zombie_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: The corpse slumps over. The monk has been released.

Zombie_59.speaker: Narrator
Zombie_59.text: *Ha! You've earned Tasha's Hideous Laughter, and you're all the more foolish for it. Congratulations!*

Zombie_47.speaker: Player
Zombie_47.text: Hold firm. You will make this curse a gift. You will not surrender your wisdom.

Zombie_54.speaker: Player
Zombie_54.text: Rally the tadpole, let it take the brunt of the damage.

Zombie_2.speaker: Player
Zombie_2.text: Relax your mind. Let the madness siphon your wisdom.

Zombie_9.speaker: Narrator
Zombie_9.text: *A lopsided grin stretches your face as the madness saps your wisdom.*

Zombie_4.speaker: Player
Zombie_4.text: Steel yourself and guide the sensations elsewhere.

Zombie_42.speaker: Player
Zombie_42.text: Call on the parasite to absorb the strike.

Zombie_11.speaker: Player
Zombie_11.text: Call on the parasite to absorb the strike.

Zombie_57.speaker: Narrator
Zombie_57.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

Zombie_33.speaker: Player
Zombie_33.text: Accept the inevitable. Allow your wisdom to drain.

Zombie_14.speaker: Player
Zombie_14.text: Enough. I want no part of this!

Zombie_19.speaker: Player
Zombie_19.text: Gods, no. I don't want to inherit your curse.

Zombie_23.speaker: Shirra Clarwen
Zombie_23.text: Well if laugh I must, let our alliance end on a lark!

Zombie_64.speaker: Player
Zombie_64.text: And what happens if I say yes?

Zombie_21.speaker: Shirra Clarwen
Zombie_21.text: Thou shalt know the extent of Shar's mania. Tasha's Hideous Laughter, at thine beck and call.

Zombie_34.speaker: Shirra Clarwen
Zombie_34.text: But at what cost, who might say? Ho-ho-HO!

Zombie_0.speaker: Player
Zombie_0.text: Ponder what you know of the monk's affliction. What are the consequences of accepting it?

Zombie_62.speaker: Narrator
Zombie_62.text: *The monk himself holds your answer. Tasha's Hideous Laughter is a powerful skill - but earning it may come at the cost of wisdom.*

Zombie_13.speaker: Narrator
Zombie_13.text: *Try as you might, you can't intuit the price of bearing the monk's madness.*

AD_MonkCombatStart_0.text: Have it thy way. Hee heeeeeee!

AD_Tomb_Plaque_01_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Tomb_Plaque_01_0.text:
*Here lies Raloric Windbane.
Born 1399 DR - Died 1486 DR*

AD_MonkEntersZombie_0.text: Oh my, oh me - here's where I be!

PAD_TombNoAmulet_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TombNoAmulet_0.text: I should retrieve the amulet - the monk's spirit should be here when I open Shirra's tomb.

PAD_Tomb_Plaque_2.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Tomb_Plaque_2.text:
*Here lies Sister Shirra Clarwen.
Date of birth unknown - Died 1491 DR*

PAD_Tomb_Plaque_5.speaker: Player
PAD_Tomb_Plaque_5.text: Gone already. Perhaps the amulet can offer some insight.

PAD_Tomb_Plaque_6.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Tomb_Plaque_6.text: *The amulet's spirit's granddaughter - she's already gone.*

PAD_Tomb_Plaque_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Tomb_Plaque_0.text: Here it is - the tomb of the amulet spirit's granddaughter. Time for a family reunion.

PAD_PostResolutionComment_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PostResolutionComment_0.text: I hate it had to end like this. A torturous fate by any measure.

PAD_PostResolutionComment_1.speaker: Player
PAD_PostResolutionComment_1.text: He's gone. Well - he was always good for a laugh.
